Key Match Events: West Indies defeated Sri Lanka by five wickets to take a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
West Indies chased down 180 in 19.1 overs with Brandon King and Evin Lewis hitting half-centuries.
Brandon King won the Player of the Match award for his outstanding knock.
Kamindu Mendis and Charith Asalanka stitched an 82-run stand for Sri Lanka.
Sherfane Rutherford finished the match with a four off Matheesha Pathirana's yorker.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies captain Rovman Powell won the toss and opted to bowl first, citing wet field conditions.
Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka mentioned he would have bowled first as well.
Post-Match Reflections: Sri Lanka lost early wickets which took the momentum away from them.
Sri Lanka's spinners managed to drag things back a little, but West Indies' smart batting took them over the line.
Sri Lanka were superb in the death overs, but early wickets could have changed the game in their favor.
